intro: Cybianthus bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá heath, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, often blooming in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
